p: Berberine ( Figure 10) is an alkaloid extracted from Berberis vulgaris L. which was extensively studied for its pharmacological activities with applications in several therapeutic areas, including cancer [ 101, 102, 103]. The antiviral activity of berberine against influenza and alphaviruses has been described [ 104]. In the SARS-CoV-2 context, Pizzorno et al. demonstrated the in vitro efficacy against SARS-CoV-2 in Vero E6 cells [ 105]. These findings agree with other studies [ 106, 107]. An in silico study reported that berberine well-recognized the main protease by establishing hydrogen bond interactions with Phe140 and Asn142 [ 108].
